trustfund:
BBGEF-BB GLOBAL ENVIRONMENTAL FUND,TF051289-GEF3 PDFB-HUNGARY:REDUCTION OF
            NUTRIENT DISCHARGES PROJECT,TF055978-GEF FSP-HUNGARY: NUTRIENT
            DISCHARGE REDUCTION PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The key development objectives of the
            Nutrient Reduction Project are: 1) to reduce Budapest's
            discharge of nutrients (nitrogen and phosphorus) into the
            Danube River, and consequently into the Black Sea; 2) to
            enhance the nutrient trapping capacity of Gemenc and
            Beda-Karapancsa wetlands situated in the lower Hungarian
            part of the Danube River; and 3) to serve as a model for
            similar nutrient reduction initiatives in Hungary and other
            Danube basin countries. The changes will involve
            introduction of amendments to the project's legal
            documents to reflect official transfer of implementing
            agency responsibilities from the former Ministry of
            Environment and Water to its legal successors the Ministry
            of Rural Development. Relevant duties of the former Ministry
            of Finance will also be transferred to its legal successor,
            the Ministry of National Economy.
